title: YouTube Embed Player with Custom Playback Controls

requirements.text: Create a single-page UI that lets the user paste a YouTube URL (or video ID), validates/parses it into a videoId, and embeds the video in the page.

quotes: build a simple app focused on a YouTube feature: embed YouTube videos

acceptanceCriteria: The page includes an input for a YouTube URL/video ID and a primary action to load the video.
The app correctly extracts the videoId from common URL formats (e.g., youtu.be/<id>, youtube.com/watch?v=<id>, youtube.com/embed/<id>) and also accepts a raw 11-char videoId.
When the input is invalid/unparseable, the UI shows a clear English error message and does not attempt to load a player.
When valid, the embedded player becomes visible and loads the requested video.

requirements.text: Implement custom playback controls that control the embedded YouTube player (Play, Pause, Seek -10s, Seek +10s, Mute/Unmute, Volume slider, Playback speed selector).

quotes: lets you control playback with custom buttons

acceptanceCriteria: Play and Pause buttons control playback of the embedded video.
Seek -10s and +10s adjust the current time accordingly (clamped to video duration bounds).
Mute/Unmute toggles the player’s mute state.
A volume slider adjusts volume from 0–100.
A playback speed selector changes speed (e.g., 0.5x, 1x, 1.5x, 2x).
Controls reflect current state where feasible (e.g., mute state, current speed).

requirements.text: Add a minimal, coherent visual theme for the app and apply it consistently (layout, colors, typography, components), without introducing additional product features.

quotes: embed YouTube videos and provide custom playback control buttons.

acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a consistent theme (e.g., dark charcoal background with warm red/orange accent, clean typography, and a centered player layout).
All user-facing text is in English.
The layout is responsive and remains usable on mobile and desktop (player scales within viewport; controls wrap/stack appropriately).

constraints: Frontend must be implemented with React + TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and the existing UI component approach (compose read-only UI components; do not modify immutable paths).
Do not add external backend services or databases; keep functionality client-side unless explicitly required.
Do not edit files under frontend immutablePaths (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/*, frontend/src/components/ui).
nonGoals: Playlists, subscriptions, comments, or any YouTube Data API integration.
Persisting watch history or favorites in the backend.
